parameters.definition: Number of poster boards that fit around a circular table
Number of participants that fit around a circular table
Number of guests catered to by a circular table
Number of poster boards that fit around a rectangular table
Number of participants that fit around a rectangular table
Number of guests catered to by a rectangular table
Space taken up by a circular table
Space taken up by a rectangular table
Minimum number of participants to accommodate
Minimum number of poster boards to accommodate
Total available space for the science fair

description: In a science fair, there are two types of tables that can be used to display the children’s science experiments. At the circular tables, \param{PosterBoardsCircular} poster boards and \param{ParticipantsCircular} participants can fit around the table to cater to \param{GuestsCircular} guests. At the rectangular tables, \param{PosterBoardsRectangular} poster boards and \param{ParticipantsRectangular} participants can fit around the table to cater to \param{GuestsRectangular} guests. However, each circular table takes up \param{SpaceCircular} units of space while each rectangular table takes up \param{SpaceRectangular} units of space. The science fair has must be able to fit at least \param{MinParticipants} participants and \param{MinPosterBoards} poster boards. If the science fair has available \param{TotalSpace} units of space, how many of each type of table should be set up to maximize the number of catered guests?
